intro: Campylochiton platypterus, commonly known as the flat-winged campylochiton, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, flat, wing-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a woody stem with a smooth, bark-like surface. It is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
